folder: Howard Avenue & Eddy Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
326 Howard Avenue, west side, south of Eddy Street, showing the gatekeeper's lodge of the John Gans estate. The estate was known as 'Kenwood" when it was owned by George H. Kendall (1907-1898).
Earlier (1874) it was the property of W. B. Duncan.
May 17, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Looking east across part of the estate toward the gatekeeper's
lodge.
May 17, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The pond on the Gans estate. It is situated nine hundred feet
directly back of the gatekeeper's lodge.
May 18, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Howard Avenue & Eddy Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
326 Howard Avenue, west side, south of Eddy Street, showing the pond on the John Gans estate. The estate was formerly owned by George H. Kendall and was called "Kenwood" (1907-1898). Prior to that it was the estate of W. B. Duncan (1874). The three views were taken the same
day.
May 18, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Eddy Street & Howard Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
35 Eddy Street, north side, between Howard and Duncan Aves.,
showing the G. L. Egbert residence.
April 1, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Howard Avenue & Eddy Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
326 Howard Avenue, west side, south of Eddy Street, showing the south end of the John Gans mansion as seen from the estate grounds. The estate was known as "Kenwood" when it was owned by George H. Kendall (1907-1898). It was earlier the property of W. B. Duncan (1874). The
three views were taken the same day.
May 17, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Howard Avenue & Eddy Street, Staten Island, NY
text:
326 Howard Avenue, west side, south of Eddy Street, showing a front view of the John Gans Mansion. It was formerly (1907-1898) the George H. Kendall mansion, and prior to that (1874), the W.B. Duncan house. The residence is 225 feet back of the
Avenue.
May 17, 1926
P.L. Sperr
(s)
Another view as seen from the south.
May 17, 1926.
P.L. Sperr
(3)
The southeast corner of the mansion.
May 17, 1926.
P.L. Sperr

text:

Howard Avenue, east side, slightly south of Eddy Street, showing the Horrmann Mansion. The view is north from the
Horrmann grounds.
April 22, 1932
